overview: Near the of World War II, two German soldiers desert their posts to go home. They eventually get captured and put in a prison camp run by the Canadian Army, where German POWs are under the command of rigid Colonel von Bleicher. When he learns about their desertion, he wants them court-martialed, even if the war has ended. To their horror, the uninterested Canadian officers oblige, and the two find themselves facing the firing squad on "the fifth day of peace".
tagline: One of the most bizarre episodes in the annals of "military justice?"
title: The 5th Day of Peace
